instructions:
Call Summarization 1

For this test, you will need to listen to information that is provided to you through the computer. We recommend using a headset or a set of quality speakers. You will then be asked a series of questions about each of the calls.

You should enter the information that the caller gives in the appropriate boxes on the computer screen. For example, you should enter the caller's first name, last name, street address, city, and/or telephone number in the boxes marked for that information. You should enter any vehicle identification number, License Plate, or Driver's License provided by the caller in the boxes marked for that information.

You may write notes about the calls in the box in the lower half of the screen labeled Notes to help you recall information about the call.

The information you record in any of the boxes on the screen will later be available to assist you in choosing the correct answer.

After each call is completed, follow the on-screen instructions to proceed to the questions about that call.

HOW TO RESPOND TO MULTIPLE-CHOICE QUESTION

With each question there will be four choices labeled A, B, C, and D. You can choose your response in one of three ways.

  1. You can use your mouse to select your answers
  2. You can use the up and down arrows to choose your response.
  3. You can hold down the Alt key and then press either A, B, C, or D.

mcqQuestions.questionText: Which of the following best summarizes the last record?

options.text: Samuel misses his sister.
Samuel should quit focusing on death.
Samuel visits his wife's grave.
Samuel is about to commit suicide.

emergencyQuestions.questionText: Electrical power lines knocked down by storm.

mcqQuestions.questionText: Which of the following best summarizes the last record?

options.text: Jim, Chip, Janine and the person telling this story all work closely together.
The person telling the story was showing off about how difficult his situation is.
Jim and the person telling the story are discussing office politics
Janine and Chip are demanding bosses.

emergencyQuestions.questionText: Man falls from top of house and breaks his back.

mcqQuestions.questionText: Which of the following best summarizes the last record?

options.text: Jerry is saving Julie from her computer trouble.
Julie is frustrated with her computer, so she phoned Jerry for help.
Julie was seated at her computer and became angry because it was malfunctioning, so she telephoned Jerry, who works at the help desk, for help.
Julie should have traded in her computer a long time ago.

mcqQuestions.questionText: Which of the following best summarizes the last record?

options.text: Kellie likes people who smile at her more than those who don't.
Kellie is positive because she likes people and the appreciation they give her.
People naturally like Kellie because Kellie likes people.
Kellie enjoys interacting with people more than making the coffee and preparing the office.

mcqQuestions.questionText: Which of the following best summarizes the last record?

options.text: Annie is lucky.
Tim guessed about how much Annie paid and wanted to impress her that she got a good deal.
Because Annie guessed the high value of the pocket watch she offered more than $50.
Annie paid a small amount of money for a pocket watch that Tim valued much higher.

WEBVTT

This is a story about Samuel
Perkin's

00:00:02.220 --> 00:00:04.160
who is a retired freight train
operator.

3
00:00:04.590 --> 00:00:06.980
He lives four houses down from the
town's cemetery.

4
00:00:07.140 --> 00:00:09.080
Every morning he gets up at 5 a.m.,

5
00:00:09.300 --> 00:00:11.190
dresses and takes a slow stroll to
the

6
00:00:11.191 --> 00:00:11.870
cemetery.

7
00:00:12.870 --> 00:00:14.820
Once there he heads directly to
visit

8
00:00:14.821 --> 00:00:16.190

9
00:00:16.710 --> 00:00:18.660
Typically he brings a small red
folding

10
00:00:18.661 --> 00:00:19.670
chair to sit upon.

11
00:00:19.950 --> 00:00:21.169
Tears fill his eyes

12
00:00:21.170 --> 00:00:22.860
and he says things like soon I will
be

13
00:00:22.861 --> 00:00:24.900
with you again my love my marriage
vow

14
00:00:24.901 --> 00:00:25.760
was everlasting.

00:00:08.341 --> 00:00:09.140

6
00:00:09.630 --> 00:00:11.460
I told Jim that I had told one of my

00:00:15.481 --> 00:00:17.490

I then had to tell Janene that I

captions.CS223:
WEBVTT

00:00:00.210 --> 00:00:02.250
My friend Julie was unsuccessfully
attempting

00:00:02.251 --> 00:00:04.379

correct

00:00:04.380 --> 00:00:06.080

4
00:00:06.330 --> 00:00:08.009

00:00:10.380 --> 00:00:12.480

00:00:12.481 --> 00:00:14.060

00:00:18.240 --> 00:00:20.210

Kelly is a receptionist that

00:00:02.790 --> 00:00:04.650
She arrives at work early to make
the

4

5
00:00:06.750 --> 00:00:08.999
Her primary responsibilities include

6
00:00:09.000 --> 00:00:10.619

8
00:00:12.450 --> 00:00:14.460
People often ask each other about
how

9
00:00:14.461 --> 00:00:16.320
she could remain so positive when
she

10
00:00:16.321 --> 00:00:18.150

00:00:18.151 --> 00:00:19.040

12
00:00:19.500 --> 00:00:21.389

13

captions.CS225:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.330 --> 00:00:02.630
My sisters friend Annie owns a
secondhand store.

2
00:00:02.760 --> 00:00:04.590
One day a man in tornned clothing
appeared

3
00:00:04.591 --> 00:00:06.480
and asked her how much she would pay
to

4
00:00:06.481 --> 00:00:08.330
buy his grandfather's pocket watch.

5
00:00:08.700 --> 00:00:09.750
And he looked at the watch

6
00:00:09.751 --> 00:00:11.180
and offered him fifty dollars.

7
00:00:11.490 --> 00:00:13.820
The man looked at the floor took a
deep breath

8
00:00:13.950 --> 00:00:15.050
and asked for one hundred.

9
00:00:15.690 --> 00:00:16.730
And he refused

10
00:00:16.980 --> 00:00:18.900
but did increaser offered a sixty.

11
00:00:19.230 --> 00:00:20.609
Again the man took a deep breath

12
00:00:20.610 --> 00:00:22.859
but this time he accepted the offer

13
00:00:22.860 --> 00:00:24.950
and pocketed the 60 dollars in cash.

14
00:00:25.290 --> 00:00:26.120
A week later

15
00:00:26.270 --> 00:00:28.110
and a jeweller friend Tim showed up

16
00:00:28.111 --> 00:00:30.230
to visit and browse their display
cases.

17
00:00:30.840 --> 00:00:32.549
He stopped to examine the pocket
watch

18
00:00:32.550 --> 00:00:34.370
and asked Annie if she knew the
value.

19
00:00:34.620 --> 00:00:35.810
She said she didn't.

20
00:00:35.820 --> 00:00:37.890
Tim told her that the pocket watch
was worth seven

21
00:00:37.891 --> 00:00:38.710
thousand dollars.
